docstr:
`KILL` â€” Send a signal to a process ### Description Sends the signal specified by `SIGNAL` to the process `PID`. See `kill(2)`. This intrinsic is provided in both subroutine and function forms; however, only one form can be used in any given program unit. ### Syntax | `STATUS = KILL(C, VALUE)`
### Arguments , with `INTENT(IN)`
| `VALUE` | Shall be a scalar `INTEGER`, with `INTENT(IN)`
| `STATUS` | (Optional) status flag of type `INTEGER(4)` or `INTEGER(8)`. Returns 0 on success, or a system-specific error code otherwise. ### Standard Sends the signal specified by `SIGNAL` to the process `PID`. See `kill(2)`. This intrinsic is provided in both subroutine and function forms; however, only one form can be used in any given program unit. ### Class Subroutine, function ### See also ABORT, EXIT
